business.headline: Exclusive: Firm run by Russian national dupes Rs 800 crore from Indian investorsThe ED filed a second chargesheet against Octafx India, its operating company overseas, OctaMarkets, its founder Pavel Prozorov, OctaFX CEO, who handled India operations, Anna Rudaia, and nine other individuals accused apart from a total of 41 companies and entities. Read this IndiaToday Exclusive.

Aviation regulator suspends 2 Akasa Air officials for lapses in pilots trainingThe two senior executives of the airline have reportedly failed to ensure compliances with the civil aviation requirements, Directorate General of Civil Aviation said.
Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu revives debate on 70-hour work weekZoho CEO Sridhar Vembu weighs in on the 70-hour work week debate initiated by Infosys founder Narayana Murthy. Here's his perspective.
Will DA rise again in 2025? All you need to knowCentral government employees await a potential DA hike in January 2025, which could offer modest relief amid rising costs
Sensex, Nifty rise for 2nd straight day as auto stocks rally The S&P BSE Sensex settled 226.59 points higher at 78,690.07, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.20 points to end at 23,813.40.

How Manmohan Singh revitalised India's economy and global standingAs the chief architect of India's 1991 economic liberalisation, Manmohan Singh's policies helped steer India away from a severe financial crisis, positioning the country as one of the world's fastest-growing economies.
Osamu Suzuki, former Suzuki Motor Corporation chairman, dies at 94Osamu Suzuki steered Suzuki Motor's rise, from pioneering Maruti 800 in India to building a global automotive legacy.

How Indian stock market benefitted under Manmohan SinghManmohan Singh's policies, introduced during a time of economic crisis in the early 1990s, reshaped India's economy and transformed the Indian stock markets.

10 income tax changes in 2024: What you need to know for filing ITR in 2025The 2024 income tax reforms introduce revised tax slabs, higher deductions, and simplified TDS and capital gains rules, making tax filing easier and offering potential savings.

Bumper stock market debut for Mamata Machinery: Should you book profit or wait? Mamata Machinery stock market listing: A 147% premium debut for Mamata Machinery leaves investors wondering: Is this the peak, or should they hold on?

DAM Capital Advisors makes strong market debut: Is it a long-term bet?DAM Capital Advisors market listing: The listing matched market predictions, as analysts and the grey market premium (GMP) had anticipated a 40%-50% premium, driven by robust demand and positive sentiment.

Sanathan Textiles shares list at 31% premium over IPO price. Hold or sell? Sanathan Textiles stock market debut: The listing comes after the company's initial public offering (IPO) witnessed robust demand, with subscriptions exceeding 36 times the total shares on offer.

Explained: Why Mazagon Dock share price is down 50% on some trading apps todayMazagon Dock stock price: Certain trading apps may be displaying the unadjusted previous closing price, leading to the perception of a 50% fall. Adjusted for the split, Mazagon Dock shares were trading 2.13% lower on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 11:09 am.

Transrail Lighting shares list at 36% premium on Dalal Street debut Transrail Lighting share price: The shares opened at Rs 585.15 per share on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The market debut aligns with market expectations, which was oversubscribed by 81 times.

DAM Capital Advisors makes strong debut, shares list at 39% premium DAM Capital Advisors listing: On the BSE, the shares began trading at Rs 392.90, marking a 38.83% premium compared to the issue price.

Mamata Machinery shares make bumper debut with 147% premium over IPO priceMamata Machinery listing: Shares of Mamata Machinery made a bumper debut and listed at Rs 600 per share on the NSE, a lot higher than the IPO issue price of Rs 243 per share.

Sensex, Nifty open higher as auto stocks fuel early rally; Tata Motors up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 323.12 points to 78,795.60, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 101.95 points to 23,852.15 as of 9:44 AM.

Dam Capital to Mamata Machinery: GMPs of 5 IPOs ahead of D-Street debut todayThese initial public offerings (IPOs), which opened for subscription on December 19 and closed on December 23, collectively raised over Rs 2,900 crore.

Manmohan Singh's key reforms that shaped Indian economyDr Manmohan Singh's tenure as Finance Minister in the early 1990s and later as Prime Minister from 2004 to 2014 introduced policies that continue to influence India's growth.

Gautam Adani on work-life balance: Spend at least 4 hours with familyChairperson of Adani Group, Gautam Adani, shared his take on work-life balance and said one must try to spend at least four hours with their families.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 62 killed in fiery plane crash in South Korea, officials say toll likely to riseA Jeju Air flight from Bangkok veered off the runway and struck a fence while landing at Muan International Airport in South Korea on Sunday, killing at least 62 people on board.

Congress vs BJP over Manmohan Singh's funeral site: 'Display of disrespect'The Congress accused the Centre of disrespecting former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh by conducting his last rites at a public crematorium, while the BJP countered by accusing the Congress of politicising the issue, despite assurances of a dedicated memorial space.

4th Test Day 4 LIVE: Marnus keeps Australia in fight despite Bumrah's brillianceAustralia (AUS) vs India (IND) 4th Test, Day 4 Live: Marnus Labuschagne has kept Australia in the fight in the Boxing Day Test match, despite Jasprit Bumrah's brilliance. Bumrah single-handed swung the momentum in India's favour on Sunday. He took four wickets, including that of Travis Head, Mitchell Marsh and Alex Carey.

Trump says he's 'in favour' of H-1B visas amid MAGA row over foreign workersDonald Trump's statement places him at the centre of a fiery row that has split his base. On one side are anti-immigration hardliners, while on the other are Silicon Valley leaders like Elon Musk, who advocate for the H1-B visa programme.

Jasprit Bumrah becomes fastest Indian pacer to 200 Test wicketsAUS vs IND: Jasprit Bumrah broke Kapil Dev's record to become the fastest Indian pacer to the landmark of 200 wickets in Test cricket. He reached the landmark on Day 4 of the Boxing Day Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
Boy, 10, falls into 39-feet borewell in Madhya Pradesh; rescue ops underwayThe boy is trapped at a depth of approximately 39 feet, and efforts to rescue him have been ongoing since Saturday night.

Manmohan Singh's bold economic reforms transformed India: UK Foreign SecretaryBritain's Foreign Secretary David Lammy pointed out that it was Manmohan's Singh's vision that laid "the foundations for today's thriving UK-India partnership."

Putin apologises for Azerbaijan plane crash, stops short of taking blameRussian President Vladimir Putin apologised to the Azerbaijan President for the crash of the Azerbaijani airliner in Kazakhstan that killed 38 people.

Video: Moment when plane veers off South Korean runway, erupts into fireballA Jeju Air plane carrying 181 passengers and crew from Bangkok crashed upon landing at Muan International Airport in South Korea on Sunday. At least 62 people were confirmed dead. Video footage from the local MBC broadcaster showed the Boeing 737-8AS veering off the runway and colliding with a concrete fence. Thick black smoke immediately billowed from the aircraft, which was quickly engulfed in flames.

UP teacher watches porn in classroom, thrashes student who caught himA second class student at a private school in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi was allegedly beaten by his teacher after the child and classmates found the latter watching pornography on his phone.

Exclusive: Firm run by Russian national dupes Rs 800 crore from Indian investorsThe ED filed a second chargesheet against Octafx India, its operating company overseas, OctaMarkets, its founder Pavel Prozorov, OctaFX CEO, who handled India operations, Anna Rudaia, and nine other individuals accused apart from a total of 41 companies and entities. Sharing 'Tom and Jerry' bond, Nitish fulfils promise to make sister proud AUS vs IND: Nitish Reddy's sister Tejaswi talked about the relationship she shares with her brother. She was delighted after the 21-year-old Nitish racked up his maiden Test hundred on Day 3 of the Boxing Day Test against Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

100 IndiGo passengers stranded at Mumbai airport as fight delayed for 16 hoursAn IndiGo flight from Mumbai to Istanbul was delayed for over 16 hours and eventually cancelled, leaving passengers stranded at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport.

Watch: WHO chief 'narrowly escapes death' in Israeli strikes at Yemen airportWHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus told BBC radio his ears were still ringing following Thursday's attack as he prepared to board a flight in Sanaa, and stressed that the protection for civilian installations under international law must be respected.

'Humble' Nitish Reddy's father touches Gavaskar's feet in emotional meetingIND vs AUS: Nitish Reddy's father Mutyala Reddy showed his respect to the legendary Sunil Gavaskar. Mutyala touched Gavaskar's feet in an emotional meeting after his son's historic century.

India bids farewell to Manmohan Singh, last rites conducted with state honoursManmohan Singh was cremated with full state honours today. The Centre agreed to allocate space for a memorial of the former Prime Minister after a war of words broke out between the BJP and the Congress.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Maharashtra man sets wife on fire after birth of 3rd daughter, arrestedA Parbhani man allegedly killed his wife after disputes over having three daughters. Neighbours tried to save her, but she succumbed to burns. Police arrested the accused for murder.

UP man, inspired by Mirzapur series, slits girlfriend's throat; arrestedAccused Mohit Saini has been in a live-in relationship with Anjali for the last two years. But when he got convinced that she was cheating on him, he decided to eliminate her.

How Dubai kunafa chocolate went viral and inspired a global trendUnless you've been living under a rock, you're likely aware of just how viral Dubai's kunafa chocolates have gone. Experts suggest that this widespread appeal heralds a brilliant business opportunity.

Kisan Mahapanchayat in Punjab on January 4, farmers to press for MSP demandFarmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who has been on a fast-unto-death since November 26, is scheduled to address the "Kisan Mahapanchayat" on January 4 at the Khnauri border.

Virat Kohli back as captain? Star batter at his animated best, sets fields at MCGAustralia vs India, 4th Test: Virat Kohli was marshalling the troops on Day 4 morning, constantly chatting with captain Rohit Sharma. The former skipper was at his animated best, much to the delight of the crowd in Melbourne.

Caught on CCTV: Haryana cafe owner assaulted for refusing to pay Rs 1 croreFinanciers attacked Jasmeet Singh after he refused to pay them Rs 1 crore, despite him already settling their dues by paying them Rs 15 lakh more than he owed.

Jr NTR enjoys family time at Hyde Park Wonderland in LondonJr NTR is currently in London, spending quality time with his family at Hyde Park's Winter Wonderland. Fans have shared glimpses of the actor's rare family outing on social media.

Salman Khan cuts cake with niece Ayat, Nita-Mukesh Ambani sing for himSalman Khan celebrated his 59th birthday with a grand party in Jamnagar. The festivities featured a special cake-cutting ceremony with his niece Ayat, while the Ambanis and other guests joined in singing the birthday song for him.

Video: Shabana-Javed Akhtar, Naseeruddin, celebs at Shyam Benegal's prayer meetVeteran actors Naseeruddin Shah, Shabana Azmi, Javed Akhtar, Urmila Matondkar, and other Bollywood celebrities gathered for a prayer meeting in honour of legendary filmmaker Shyam Benegal.

Uorfi Javed on walking out of Samay Raina's show: I was abused on stageUorfi Javed expressed her anger after contestants made derogatory remarks against her on India's Got Latent show. The social media sensation shared that she was compared to Mia Khalifa.

sports.headline: Injury crisis hits Australia: Keeper ruled out, pacer provides key updateIND vs AUS: Australia wicketkeeper-batter Josh Inglis has been ruled out for the remainder of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Cricket Australia announced the development on Sunday, 29 December after Inglis suffered a calf strain.

The drop offered Marnus Labuschagne a lifeline when the Australian star was batting on 46.

His emotional celebration, saluting the Indian flag, reflected the deep gesture towards making his country proud.

Carlsen refused to follow rules, left us with little choice: Viswanathan AnandMagnus Carlsen withdrew from the FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Championship after refusing to follow the tournament's dress code. Viswanathan Anand stated that FIDE had no choice but to enforce rules, ensuring fairness for all players.

Can Markram steer the hosts to victory, or will Pakistan script a stunning turnaround?

Rishabh Pant thinks rash shots are the only way to score runs: Sunil GavaskarFormer India cricketer turned commentator criticised India wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant for his careless shot on Day 3 of the fourth Test against Australia in Melbourne.

Will return better than ever: Lamine Yamal gives strong promise amidst injuryLamine Yamal vowed to return stronger after injuries disrupted his promising season, leaving Barcelona struggling in his absence as they lost their LaLiga top spot. The 17-year-old assured fans of his commitment to overcoming setbacks and regaining peak form.

ICC Women's emerging cricketer of the year: India's rising player nominatedShreyanka Patil's stellar performances in 2024, including 15 T20I wickets and key contributions in major tournaments, earned her a nomination for ICC Women's Emerging Cricketer of the Year.

Nitish borrows Cummins' mentality, Klaasen's gameplan for MCG Test hundredNitish Kumar Reddy became the first Indian No.8 to score a Test century in Australia. Reddy scored his maiden Test hundred on Day 3 of the fourth Test against Australia in Melbourne.

SA vs PAK: Babar Azam ends two-year-long 50 drought in Centurion TestStar Pakistan batter Babar Azam brought up his first Test half century after a long gap of two years on Day 3 of the first Test against South Africa in Centurion.

Can India win MCG Test if they concede lead? Here's what history says Border Gavaskar Trophy, IND vs AUS: At Stumps on Day 3 of the MCG Test, India trialed by 116 runs after Nitish Kumar Reddy's maiden Test hundred. But can India secure victory or salvage a draw from the position they are in?

PM Modi meets D Gukesh, receives signed chess board from world championPM Narendra Modi hailed D Gukesh's historic World Chess Championship victory during their meeting. The young champion gifted the Prime Minister a signed chessboard, symbolising his triumph and India's growing prominence in the global chess arena.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
